title: Install the game on my Windows PC
description: As a Windows PC gamer, I want to run a simple, guided installer for Monopoly Tycoon, so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors, and start playing right away.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I run the installer with default options, when I complete the wizard, then the game is installed, listed in 'Add or Remove Programs', and a desktop shortcut is created.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I start the installer on a machine with insufficient disk space, when I try to install, then an error message is shown and the installation is blocked.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I run the installer as a standard user, when I start the process, then a Windows UAC prompt appears requesting administrative privileges.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Installer is a single .exe. Uninstaller entry is created. Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user installing the game, I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my personal preferences.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when I select a valid directory on a different drive, then the game files are installed into that custom directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when I select a drive with insufficient space, then an error message is displayed and the 'Next' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I am on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when I proceed with the default path, then the game is installed in the default system-provided directory.
technical_tasks: WI-005: Create Inno Setup Installer Script
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Unit/Integration tests pass with required coverage. Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: Ensure UI and Game View Adapt to Different Monitor Aspect Ratios
description: As a PC gamer with a monitor of any common aspect ratio, I want the game's user interface and 3D view to automatically adapt to my screen's dimensions so that I can play the game without any visual distortion, overlapping elements, or loss of critical information.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is launched on a standard 16:9 display, when the user views the main gameplay screen, then all HUD elements are positioned correctly and no graphics are stretched.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is launched on an ultrawide 21:9 display, when the user views the main gameplay screen, then the HUD elements remain anchored to the corners and the game board maintains its correct proportions.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is running in windowed mode, when the user drags the window border to resize it, then the UI layout dynamically updates to fit the new dimensions without errors.

definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Unit/Integration tests pass with required coverage. Feature verified in a staging build for all target aspect ratios. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
description: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is running, when an unhandled exception occurs, then a modal error dialog is displayed to the user.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the error dialog is displayed, when the user views it, then it contains a user-friendly message, a unique Error ID, and the path to the log files.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an error ID is shown to the user, when the user checks the log file, then an ERROR level entry with the same ID and full exception details is present.

column14: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Error dialog is visually polished and non-technical. Log flushing is confirmed to happen before application termination. Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed, I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space, ensuring my system remains clean.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed, when I uninstall it via 'Apps & features', then all application files, shortcuts, and the 'Apps & features' entry are removed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the uninstaller presents the option to keep personal data, when I choose to KEEP the data, then the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory remains.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the uninstaller presents the option to keep personal data, when I choose to REMOVE the data, then the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory is also deleted.

description: As a human player whose turn it is, I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice, so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.

acceptance_criteria_3: Given my turn results in being sent to Jail, when my token moves, then it follows a special, direct animation to the 'In Jail' section of the board, bypassing normal movement.

acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress, when I place a winning bid and all others withdraw, then the bid amount is deducted, I receive the property, and the auction ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress, when I select 'Withdraw', then I can no longer place bids in this auction.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given my cash is less than the minimum next bid, when it is my turn, then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled.

acceptance_criteria_2: Given I do not own a complete color set, when I view my properties, then the option to build is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I have insufficient funds, when I try to build, then the action is blocked and I am notified.

acceptance_criteria_2: Given every property in a monopoly has 1 house, when I try to build a second house on any of them, then the action is successful.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Property A has 3 houses and B has 2, when I try to sell a house from B, then the action is blocked, forcing me to sell from A first.

acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly with 4 houses on each property but have insufficient cash for a hotel, when I view the property, then the 'Build Hotel' option is disabled.

acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a property with houses, when I open the trade interface, then that property is disabled in the selection list with a tooltip explaining why.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
description: As a strategic player negotiating with an AI, I want to respond to their trade proposal with a modified counter-offer, so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my strategic goals.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI proposes a trade, when I click 'Propose Counter-Offer', then the main trading UI opens, pre-populated with the AI's original offer.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the counter-offer UI is open, when I modify the offer and submit it, then the AI evaluates the new offer and responds with either 'Accepted' or 'Declined'.

title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other
description: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given AI 1 successfully trades 'Boardwalk' to AI 2 for $500, when the trade is complete, then a notification appears on my screen summarizing the trade (e.g., 'Trade: AI 1 sent Boardwalk to AI 2 for $500').
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the notification appears, when it is displayed, then it does not pause the game and disappears automatically after a few seconds.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given AI 1 proposes a trade to AI 2 but it is rejected, when the offer is declined, then no notification is displayed to me.
technical_tasks: WI-019: Implement AI Trading Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Notification text is concise and accurate. Feature works correctly on all game speed settings. Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
description: As a property owner, I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own an undeveloped property in a monopoly, when an opponent lands on it, then double the base rent is automatically transferred from them to me.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent lands on it, then no rent is collected.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given an opponent with insufficient funds lands on my property, when rent is due, then the game identifies they cannot pay and initiates the bankruptcy process.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Develop Turn Management State Machine
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Rent calculation logic is 100% accurate for all property types and states. Integration with bankruptcy system is successful. Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
description: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I land on an opponent's property with 3 houses, when my move ends, then the correct rent for a 3-house property is deducted from my cash and credited to the owner.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I land on an opponent's mortgaged property, when my move ends, then no rent is charged and my cash remains unchanged.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I land on a property where the rent is more than my total assets, when my move ends, then the game initiates the bankruptcy process for my player.
technical_tasks: WI-010: Develop Turn Management State Machine
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Rent payment is atomic. UI feedback is clear. Integration with bankruptcy system is successful. Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
description: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am the last non-bankrupt player in the game, when the final opponent goes bankrupt, then the main game view is replaced by a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when I view it, then it displays a 'Victory!' message, my profile name, my final net worth, and the game duration.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when I interact with it, then it has a functional button to navigate to the 'Game Summary' screen and another to 'Return to Main Menu'.

definition_of_done: WI-023: Implement Victory and Game Over Screens

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
description: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game and am no longer an active participant.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am declared bankrupt, when the bankruptcy process concludes, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the 'Game Over' screen is displayed, when I view it, then it contains a prominent 'Game Over' header and a single button labeled 'View Game Summary'.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given I click 'View Game Summary' and multiple AIs remain, when the screen transitions, then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI turns begins until a single AI winner is determined.

definition_of_done: WI-023: Implement Victory and Game Over Screens

title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
description: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players and understand the final outcome.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has ended (win or loss), when I navigate to the summary screen, then it displays a statistics section for all players who participated in the match.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, when I review the statistics, then the values for 'Final Net Worth', 'Total Rent Collected', and 'Properties Owned' are accurate for each player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, when I interact with it, then a 'Return to Main Menu' button is visible and functional.

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
description: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the financial standing of my opponents and myself.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a new 4-player game has started, when the main game board is loaded, then a HUD is visible with four panels, each showing a player's name, token icon, and starting cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is a player's turn, when I view the HUD, then that player's panel has a distinct visual highlight to indicate they are the active player.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player's cash balance changes, when the transaction completes, then their cash display in the HUD updates immediately.

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
description: As a player, I want clear, player-specific visual indicators on each property space on the board so that I can instantly understand who owns what, identify monopolies, and make faster strategic decisions.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player purchases an unowned property, when the transaction completes, then a visual marker corresponding to the new owner's color immediately appears on that property space.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player mortgages an owned property, when the transaction completes, then the ownership marker's visual state changes to clearly signify it is mortgaged (e.g., becomes semi-transparent).
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a property's ownership changes due to a trade or bankruptcy, when the asset transfer is complete, then the marker on the property immediately updates to show the new owner's color/token.

definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Code reviewed and merged. Visual state changes are immediate and accurate. Indicators do not rely on color alone (accessibility). Feature verified in a staging build. No new high-priority bugs introduced.

acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI proposes a trade, when the offer is presented, then a modal dialog appears pausing the game and presenting me with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Counter-Offer' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given any critical decision modal is active, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside the modal, then the clicks are ignored and only interactions within the modal are registered.

acceptance_criteria_3: Given I own an undeveloped property, when I am in the management screen, then I can successfully mortgage that property for its listed value.

acceptance_criteria_3: Given an AI makes me an offer, when the interface appears, then it is pre-populated with the AI's offer, and I am presented with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Counter-Offer' buttons.

title: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules.

acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when I view the slots, then each occupied slot displays metadata like the profile name, save timestamp, and turn number.

title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
